summary: The Homeland Security Climate Change Coordination Act (H.R. 3002) aims to establish a council within the Department of Homeland Security to address the impacts of global climate change on the department's programs and operations. The council, composed of various DHS officials, will identify climate change impacts, develop mitigation strategies, make recommendations for resource realignment, and oversee the implementation of related executive orders. The Secretary of Homeland Security is required to submit annual reports to Congress regarding the council's actions.
